Gene Synonyms

Source: R/geneSynonyms.R
geneSynonyms.Rd

Look up gene synonyms from NCBI.

geneSynonyms(organism = c("Homo sapiens", "Mus musculus",
  "Drosophila melanogaster"))

Arguments

organism

string. Spported organisms: Homo sapiens, Mus musculus, Drosophila melanogaster.

Value

grouped_df, grouped by geneID column.

Note

Synonym support for Caenorhabditis elegans is poor on NCBI. Use the wormbase package instead.

See also

Other Annotation Functions: annotable, broadClass, convertGenesToSymbols, convertTranscriptsToGenes, convertUCSCBuildToEnsembl, detectOrganism, eggnog, emptyRanges, hgnc2gene, makeGRangesFromEnsembl, makeGRangesFromGFF, makeGene2symbolFromEnsembl, makeGene2symbolFromGFF, makeTx2geneFromEnsembl, makeTx2geneFromGFF, mgi2gene, panther, stripTranscriptVersions

Examples

x <- geneSynonyms(organism = "Homo sapiens")
#> Parsed with column specification:
#> cols(
#>   `#tax_id` = col_integer(),
#>   GeneID = col_integer(),
#>   Symbol = col_character(),
#>   LocusTag = col_character(),
#>   Synonyms = col_character(),
#>   dbXrefs = col_character(),
#>   chromosome = col_character(),
#>   map_location = col_character(),
#>   description = col_character(),
#>   type_of_gene = col_character(),
#>   Symbol_from_nomenclature_authority = col_character(),
#>   Full_name_from_nomenclature_authority = col_character(),
#>   Nomenclature_status = col_character(),
#>   Other_designations = col_character(),
#>   Modification_date = col_integer(),
#>   Feature_type = col_character()
#> )
glimpse(x)
#> Observations: 19,335
#> Variables: 3
#> $ geneID   <chr> "ENSG00000000003", "ENSG00000000005", "ENSG00000000419", "...
#> $ geneName <chr> "TSPAN6", "TNMD", "DPM1", "SCYL3", "FGR", "CFH", "FUCA2", ...
#> $ synonyms <chr> "T245, TM4SF6, TSPAN-6", "BRICD4, CHM1L, TEM", "CDGIE, MPD...
